TopicTitle: In-orbit vessel pitch/yaw switch after switching vessel or reloading the game

Articles.Content:
Problem description

A issue I've ran into since launch that the latest patch (released 16th of march) did not fix is that the pitch and yaw controls switch after reaching orbit and switching vessels (unless the vessel is close) or reloading the game.
This issue also affects the SAS, which means that when turning on the SAS, the vessel spins out of control.
I've experienced this issue across multiple vessels (different designs) and multiple campaigns.

Video
To further explain the issue, I've uploaded a video:

When watching the video, pay attention to the arrows around the navball, indicating the pitch/yaw/roll inputs.

Start of the video (00:05)

The pitch and yaw work as intended, as can be seen by looking at the arrows around the navball.
The SAS is also working as intended.

After reloading the campaign (00:58)

After saving and reloading the campaign, you can see that the pitch and yaw are swapped, as indicated by the arrows around the navball.
When pressing W on the keyboard, the arrow indicates that the vessel is pitching, but looking at the navball and the vessel you can see that the vessel is actually yawing.
When turning on SAS (01:22) the craft starts spinning out of control, as the pitch and yaw are also swapped for the SAS.
Clicking "Control From Here" on either the Kerbal Pod or the Probe does not fix the issue.

PC/KSP information

  • KSP version: 0.1.1.0.21572 (Issue also occurred with the initial Early Access version)
  • Operating system: Windows 11 Pro - 22H2, build 22621.1413
  • CPU:  Intel Core i5-12600k
  • GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070
  • RAM: 16GB
